result.execSummary:
The defendant Andy L. Follen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION ON COUNTS 1&2 ARE FOR 4 YEARS; TERM OF PROBATION FOR COUNT 3 IS 1 YEAR ONLY. PROBATION IS TO RUN CONCURRENT ON ALL COUNTS AS ARE THE CONDITIONS UNLESS OTHERWISE SPECIFIED.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office. 14CF34 Cts1&2 Bail jumping 946.49(1)(b) and Ct3 Intimidate Victim/Witness 940.44(2) was dismissed and read-in to this case.
Concurrent with: Probation on counts 1,2&3 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes:
State granted 30 days to apply to the Court for restitution. 
8-20-2015 no restitution requested, bond applied to costs and remaining refunded

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all felony convictions.
Defendant ordered to pay the service fee incured in this case.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request. Additionally, defendant is to complete a Sex Offender Evaluation, following all recommendations and releasing the records to the agent.

The defendant shall have no contact with S.L.K. or K.J.B. or their immediate families or their residence  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

Defendant is not to have any contact with females under age 18 without the agents prior approval, with the exception of incidental contact as defined by the Court.

Defendant is not to hold any positions either paid or volunteer,-specifically teaching or positions that has responsibility for individuals under the age of 18.

Defendant is not to access any social media sites on the internet including gaming sites with chat elements available.

Defendant is not to have any electronic devices without the prior approval of the agent which may without cause or warning monitor any devices in the defendants posession.
Defendant is to follow all DOC standard Sex Offender rules but is specifically NOT required to register with the Sex Offender Registry.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted huber privileges and is to report on or before 8-1-2015 at 9:30am. Defendant granted credit for 3 days served. Jail sentence applies to count 3 only.

The defendant shall have no contact with K.B., S.K., or R.S. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to be on or around the premises of the Abbotsford School Grounds, or any school grounds without prior approval from the Court.  Defendant needs to call the Sheriff's Department every Friday before 6:00 pm from a landline telephone to verify where he is at and needs to stay in the State of Wisconsin.
